cellularAutomata.lattice
Class OneDimensionalLattice

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
              cellularAutomata.lattice.OneDimensionalLattice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lattice, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Cell>, java.util.Collection<Cell>, java.util.List<Cell>, java.util.RandomAccess
Direct Known Subclasses:
MargolusOneDimensionalLattice, MooreRadiusOneDimLattice, NextNearestOneDimLattice, StandardOneDimensionalLattice
public abstract class OneDimensionalLattice
extends java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
implements Lattice

A one-dimensional lattice. Extend this class to create any lattice that can have its associated cells stored in a one-dimensional array.
The neighbors (in other words, the getNeighboringCells() method) are what make different one-dimensional lattices unique. For example, wrap around conditions may or may not be implemented in the getNeighboringCells() method. And we can implement lattices with nearest neighbors or with with next-nearest neighbors simply by changing the getNeighboringCells() method.
Note that by contract, all Lattices must have a constructor with the parameters String, Rule, int, and Properties. These are necessary for using reflection properly.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

MAX_RECOMMENDED_CELLS

public static final long MAX_RECOMMENDED_CELLS
The maximum number of cells that the one-dimensional simulation should attempt before memory and speed become a problem.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

OneDimensionalLattice

public OneDimensionalLattice()
Default constructor required of all Lattices (for reflection). Typically not used to build the lattice, but instead used to gain access to methods such as getDisplayName() and getNumberOfNeighbors().

OneDimensionalLattice

public OneDimensionalLattice(java.lang.String initialStateFilePath,
                             Rule rule,
                             int maxHistory)
Create a one-dimensional cellular automaton with the same rule at all positions. The length of the automaton and the initial state of each cell is specified in a file.

Parameters:
rule - The rule applied to all cells.
initialStateFilePath - The path to the file that specifies the initial state of the cellular automaton. If null or invalid, a default initial state is created.
maxHistory - The maximum number of generations (or time steps) that will be remembered by the Cells on the lattice.

OneDimensionalLattice

public OneDimensionalLattice(Cell[] cells)
Create a one-dimensional lattice from the given cells. Each cell is assumed to already have an assigned value.

Parameters:
cells - The cells used to fill the lattice.

OneDimensionalLattice

public OneDimensionalLattice(java.lang.String initialStateFilePath,
                             Rule rule)
Create a one-dimensional cellular automaton with the same rule at all positions. The length of the automaton and the initial state of each cell is specified in a file.

Parameters:
rule - The rule applied to all cells.
initialStateFilePath - The path to the file that specifies the initial state of the cellular automaton. If null or invalid, a default initial state is created.
Method Detail

getCells

public Cell[] getCells()
Gets all of the cells that make up this lattice. No order is guaranteed but is generally obvious. Generally, for two-dimensional square lattices, the element array[row][col] is accessed at array[row * width + col].

Specified by:
getCells in interface Lattice
Returns:
The array of cells that make up this lattice.

getFileStorage

public FileStorage getFileStorage()
Gets the class that tells the lattice how to store its data in a file.

Specified by:
getFileStorage in interface Lattice
Returns:
The storage class that tells the lattice how to save to a file.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
The width (or number of columns, or length) of the lattice. In one-dimensional lattices, this is the only meaningful dimension.

Specified by:
getWidth in interface Lattice
Returns:
the number of columns in the lattice.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
The height (or number of rows) of the lattice. In one-dimensional lattices, this is always 1.

Specified by:
getHeight in interface Lattice
Returns:
the number of rows in the lattice.

getMaxStateHistory

public static int getMaxStateHistory(Rule rule)
Gets an appropriate value for the number of generations that the state history should store. At a minimum, must store the current state and the previous state.

Returns:
The size of the state history.

getNeighbors

public Cell[] getNeighbors(Cell cell)
Returns an array of all cells that are connected to the specified cell, excluding itself. For the one-dimensional lattice this is the cell to the left and the cell to its right.

Specified by:
getNeighbors in interface Lattice
Parameters:
cell - The specified cell.
Returns:
The neighbors of the specified cell.

getNumberOfNeighbors

public static int getNumberOfNeighbors(java.lang.String latticeDescription)
The number of neighbors for a cell on the current CA lattice. If the number of neighbors changes with lattice position, then this method returns -1. This utility method is not specific to one-dimensional lattices, and works equally well with two-dimensional lattices. It belongs in a base class, but that base class does not exist.

Returns:
The number of neighbors for a cell on the current lattice, or -1 if the number of neighbors changes with position.

isCurrentLatticeOneDim

public static boolean isCurrentLatticeOneDim()
Tests if the CA's current lattice (as set in the properties) is one-dimensional.

Returns:
true if the lattice is a one-dimensional lattice.

isCurrentLatticeOneDim

public static boolean isCurrentLatticeOneDim(java.lang.String latticeDescription)
Tests if the lattice's display description corresponds to a one-dimensional lattice.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The lattice display description.
Returns:
true if the display name is for a one-dimensional lattice.

setFileStorage

public void setFileStorage(FileStorage storage)
Sets the class that tells the lattice how to store its data in a file. Not necessary to set unless desired because a default is always provided.

Specified by:
setFileStorage in interface Lattice
Parameters:
storage - The storage class that tells the lattice how to save to a file.

setInitialState

public void setInitialState(java.lang.String filePathOrProperty)
Sets the state of all the cells on the lattice by reading values from a file. The data in the file should be ordered linearly.

Specified by:
setInitialState in interface Lattice
Parameters:
filePathOrProperty - The path to the file containing the initial state of the automaton. For example, "C:/initial.data". May be a property value instead of a file path such as PropertyReader.STATE_BLANK, PropertyReader.STATE_SINGLE_SEED, or PropertyReader.STATE_RANDOM.
